Commentary: Holder to Hanuma Vihari, no run, he's given out, and Jason Holder has a 5-wicket haul until the end of this review at least. Seaming back in from outside off, beating the inside edge on the backfoot nudge into the on-side. Going over the top of leg-stump! The umpire has to reverse his decision, and Holder is denied his third consecutive five-for at Jamaica - for now.
reviews: Over 115.2: Review by India (Batting), Umpire - PR Reiffel, Batsman - GH Vihari (Upheld)

Commentary: Roach to Hanuma Vihari, leg byes, 1 run, horrible review from Roach. West Indies have lost both their reviews now. Angled in and Vihari falls over as he misses the flick, struck him around leg-stump and the angle was taking it further down. Holder gestured it was going down but Roach was adamant that it was close
reviews: Over 61.3: Review by West Indies (Bowling), Umpire - PR Reiffel, Batsman - GH Vihari (Struck down)

Commentary: Roach to Agarwal, no run, gone! Is he? Agarwal reviews! Seams away from the inward angle, trapped on the backfoot, is Agarwal, as he pokes away from the body. There's some bat-on-pad action. Yep, easily missing the bat, and the third umpire is convinced - the umpire has to revise his decision to NOT OUT!
reviews: Over 39.1: Review by India (Batting), Umpire - PR Reiffel, Batsman - MA Agarwal (Upheld)

Commentary: Cornwall to Kohli, no run, a huge lbw appeal and it's been turned down! West Indies have decided to challenge the onfield call, after all it's the Indian skipper. This looks close but it could be probably spinning down the leg side. Huge amount of spin and Kohli gets beaten due to the same on his flick. Nothing on UltraEdge, the impact is in line and it's missing the leg stump by a huge margin. Could have probably hit the sixth stump, if there was one. So, West Indies have lost one review and Kohli still has the chance to open his account
reviews: Over 20.3: Review by West Indies (Bowling), Umpire - RA Kettleborough, Batsman - V Kohli (Struck down)

Commentary: Roach to Agarwal, out Lbw! Looks like he's gone! Agarwal goes for a review. That seamed back in rather sharply and struck him fairly low. Not a no-ball. Scrambled-seamer, seaming back in, beating the hopping batsman on the bottom-handed defence and it's umpire's call on hitting - clipping the top of middle and leg! A forlorn Agarwal trudges back to the pavilion as West Indies draw first blood. Agarwal lbw b Roach 4(15) [4s-1]
reviews: Over 4.6: Review by India (Batting), Umpire - RA Kettleborough, Batsman - MA Agarwal (Struck down - Umpires Call)

Commentary: Cornwall to Rahane, no run, reviewed for the sake of it. Cornwall was not convinced. He didn't even appeal but Hamilton was and Holder went with his keeper's word. Rahane jumps out of the crease and is defeated by the turn in, beaten on the inside edge and the ball pops up off the flap of the pad, Hamilton hangs on to the ball and goes up immediately
reviews: Over 27.4: Review by West Indies (Bowling), Umpire - PR Reiffel, Batsman - AM Rahane (Struck down)

Commentary: Ishant to Roston Chase, no run, that's hooped back in at Chase who's clearly staggered. He was prepared to leave it, saw it bend in sharply and made a belated, albeit unsuccessful attempt to keep it from hitting the front pad. Huge shout from India. Umpire Kettleborough says no. Not much hesitation from Kohli in going for the review, but ball-tracking has it going over the stumps. Even the impact was umpire's call on off stump
reviews: Over 22.5: Review by India (Bowling), Umpire - RA Kettleborough, Batsman - RL Chase (Struck down)

Commentary: Ishant to Roach, no run, another sharp bouncer outside off, good carry on it, Roach tries to fend it away, but gets beaten due to the bounce. Pant was up in a caught behind appeal and the Indians have used up a review too. But replays show there was daylight when the ball whizzed past his gloves. India have lost one review - one remaining
reviews: Over 44.2: Review by India (Bowling), Umpire - PR Reiffel, Batsman - KAJ Roach (Struck down)

Commentary: Ishant to Roach, no run, Roach has been given OUT LBW and he wants a review. It's a fair delivery and think there's no bat on that, but is it sailing over the stumps? UltraEdge confirms that there's no edge and it's indeed going over the top. NOT OUT it is. Ishant shortened his length and gets it to hold its line around off, Roach shuffled across, was on his toes as he looked to clip and missed, struck high on the thigh-pad
reviews: Over 20.4: Review by West Indies (Batting), Umpire - RA Kettleborough, Batsman - KAJ Roach (Upheld)

Commentary: Bumrah to Roach, no run, loud shout for LBW and India have decided to review. was it swinging down leg? Was it high? It's a fair delivery and it has hit Roach above the knee-roll, almost around the flap of the pad, no bat and UltraEdge confirms it, sliding past leg-stump and India lose a review. An optimistic review from India, but you wouldn't blamce them too much. On a good length and kept coming with the angle, Roach was pushing forward in defence and is beaten on the inside edge, struck him in front of leg and that was always sliding down
reviews: Over 15.5: Review by India (Bowling), Umpire - RJ Tucker, Batsman - KAJ Roach (Struck down)

Commentary: Bumrah to Roach, no run, fuller length delivery and holding its line outside off, Roach covers the line, lifts his bat and lets it go
reviews: Over 15.4: Review by India (Bowling), Umpire - RJ Tucker, Batsman - KAJ Roach (Struck down)

Commentary: Roach to Rahane, no run, loud shout for LBW and West Indies will review. Rahane was shuffling a long way across, but was the angle taking the ball down leg? Looks like no bat on that and UltraEdge confirms it. The impact is in front of leg and is sliding down leg, poor review from West Indies. Looked like going down to the naked eye and Hawk-Eye confirmed it, full and angling into Rahane's pads, he was looking to flick and missed
reviews: Over 44.2: Review by West Indies (Bowling), Umpire - RJ Tucker, Batsman - AM Rahane (Struck down)

Commentary: Shami to Gabriel, no run, An lbw appeal against Gabriel and umpire Richard Kettleborough is unmoved. An in-angler at 139kph and Gabriel is late on the glance. The impact is outside leg and that's going further down. India lose a review
reviews: Over 73.2: Review by India (Bowling), Umpire - RA Kettleborough, Batsman - ST Gabriel (Struck down)

Commentary: Shami to Miguel Cummins, no run, edged and gone? The umpire's finger went up and Miguel Cummins reviewed that quickly. Fair delivery. Seam up delivery, full and marginally outside off, Cummins - with cemented feet movement - brings his bat down a touch late. No bat and the same has been confirmed by UltraEdge. Successful review and Richard Kettleborough has reversed his decision. The bat hit the ground after the ball passed and hence the noise
reviews: Over 71.5: Review by West Indies (Batting), Umpire - RA Kettleborough, Batsman - ML Cummins (Upheld)

Commentary: Roach to Jadeja, no run, big shout for lbw and up goes the finger of umpire Richard Kettleborough. Jadeja reviews instantly. Fair delivery. In-slanter from round the wicket and there's a clear inside edge onto his pad. The same has been confirmed by UltraEdge. For the second time in the day, Kettleborough has to reverse his original decision. On a length and Jadeja was pressing forward to block it out. got a thick inside edge that later deflected onto his front leg
reviews: Over 60.6: Review by India (Batting), Umpire - RA Kettleborough, Batsman - RA Jadeja (Upheld)

Commentary: Boult to Dilruwan Perera, no run, another review for an lbw - this time the original decision is not out and Kane has decided to go upstairs. This looks like it pitched outside leg, hence the batsman might get away with it. Was a toe-crushing yorker by Boult and the batsman was in no postion to play it. Dilruwan Perera tried his best to squeeze it out but the jaffa was too good for him. Had it pitched in line, this could have been plumb. A game of fine margins, isn't it? Meanwhile, the batsman getting some treatment as he seems to be rattled by the impact. Good decision, nevertheless..
reviews: Over 44.6: Review by New Zealand (Bowling), Umpire - MA Gough, Batsman - MDK Perera (Struck down)

Commentary: Ajaz Patel to Karunaratne, no run, Karunaratne has gone for a review straightaway. He has been given out bat-pad to slip. It spun back in viciously, beats the inside edge of Karunaratne. There was a noise for sure but his bat has hit the pad at the same time when ball made contact with the pad. There is clear daylight between bat and ball and umpire Michael Gough will have to change his decision. Karunaratne survives!
reviews: Over 28.3: Review by Sri Lanka (Batting), Umpire - MA Gough, Batsman - FDM Karunaratne (Upheld)

Commentary: Somerville to Kusal Perera, no run, Perera tries the reverse sweep and misses, impact outside off stump on the back thigh, KW took the chance with the review and ended up duming on
reviews: Over 79.4: Review by New Zealand (Bowling), Umpire - MA Gough, Batsman - MDKJ Perera (Struck down)

Commentary: Dhananjaya de Silva to Ajaz Patel, no run, appeal for LBW and Sri Lanka want a review. The impact was definitely outside off, but Ajaz wasn't playing a shot. Did it spin back enough to hit the stumps? It's missing and Sri Lanka have now lost both reviews. Fraction short and spinning back into the left-hander, Ajaz was caught in between playing and leaving, left it at the last moment and was hit on the pads
reviews: Over 103.2: Review by Sri Lanka (Bowling), Umpire - MA Gough, Batsman - AY Patel (Struck down)

Commentary: Dananjaya to Watling, no run, wrong 'un and not sure Watling picked it, he pressed forward to defend and the ball grazes the inside edge before hitting the pad, the impact was in-line with middle and that prompted Sri Lanka to take the review. Guess no one spotted the tiny bit of wood. Only one review left for the hosts
reviews: Over 61.6: Review by Sri Lanka (Bowling), Umpire - MA Gough, Batsman - BJ Watling (Struck down)

Commentary: Lasith Embuldeniya to Watling, no run, third decision that has been overturned under Illingworth's watch. The ball drifts across and then spins across, Watling plays all around it and gets into a tangle as well, luckily for him there was some bat before ball went on to hit the back pad. If not for that, Watling was a dead duck
reviews: Over 30.2: Review by New Zealand (Batting), Umpire - RK Illingworth, Batsman - BJ Watling (Upheld)

Commentary: Boult to Lasith Embuldeniya, no run, loud shout for LBW and KW will not get any advice from the close-in cordon, makes a belated call for a review. To the naked eye, this looked like slipping down leg. It's a fair ball and it has missed the bat. UltraEdge confirms it. The impact is in front of leg and the angle should be taking it past the leg-stump. Missing and New Zealand have lost their second review as well. This was very full and kept sliding down the leg-side, Embuldeniya was looking to flick and missed
reviews: Over 88.5: Review by New Zealand (Bowling), Umpire - MA Gough, Batsman - L Embuldeniya (Struck down)

Commentary: Somerville to Lakmal, no run, Lakmal has been given out caught at slip. He isn't sure about the decision and has decided to challenge it. There is a clear day light between the bat and pad and UltraEdge confirms there in no edge on it.  There were two noises and it might have triggered the umpire Richard Illingworth to raise his finger. DRS comes to the rescue of Lakmal and he survives. It spun back in sharply, missed the inside edge and ends up at slip off the pads
reviews: Over 59.4: Review by Sri Lanka (Batting), Umpire - RK Illingworth, Batsman - RAS Lakmal (Upheld)

Commentary: Santner to Kusal Mendis, no run, Santner gets it to skid off the deck and Kusal Mendis misses the tuck. It rapped him on the pads but was sliding down. It didn't straighten enough but  Kane thought otherwise and went for the review, he was proved wrong within a minute. New Zealand lose their review too
reviews: Over 27.1: Review by New Zealand (Bowling), Umpire - RK Illingworth, Batsman - BKG Mendis (Struck down)

Commentary: Dananjaya to Somerville, no run, Somerville has been given out bat-pad to FSL but he has asked for a review. There is no bat or glove involved here, says the third umpire. He will check for lbw too. The impact was umpire's call and it was easily missing the stumps. Too high and Somerville will survive! It spins back into Somerville, he was defeated by the turn. It struck him on the pads and ended up into the hands of FSL. The umpire thought there was an inside edge and he raised the finger. But Somerville reviewed and he was proved right!
reviews: Over 78.5: Review by New Zealand (Batting), Umpire - RK Illingworth, Batsman - WER Somerville (Upheld)

Commentary: Ashwin to George Linde, no run, George Linde went for the slog across the line and missed it. The ball hit him on the front pad and the impact was on leg-stick. There was no bat as HawkEye clarified but that was also going down leg. But was it a slider? Not sure
reviews: Over 41.3: Review by India (Bowling), Umpire - NJ Llong, Batsman - GF Linde (Struck down)

Commentary: Jadeja to Zubayr Hamza, no run, India review: This looks to be sliding down the leg side to the naked eye. India might lose their review. Yup, they have. Was a fullish delivery around middle and leg, Zubayr Hamza was trying to defend it, but the ball kept straight and struck him on the pads. Impact was on leg, but the angle was taking it down the leg side. Reviews left: South Africa - 2 | India - 1
reviews: Over 27.3: Review by India (Bowling), Umpire - NJ Llong, Batsman - Zubayr Hamza (Struck down)

Commentary: D Piedt to Rohit, leg byes, 1 run, South Africa have a review: It's an ungainly slog sweep. Well, well, Sharma's clearly bored here with Piedt's negative lines from round the wicket into his pads. So he decides to have a slog-sweep, misses, but the balls pitching a cool few centimeters down leg
reviews: Over 80.4: Review by South Africa (Bowling), Umpire - RK Illingworth, Batsman - RG Sharma (Struck down)

Commentary: Rabada to Rohit, no run, no sooner had umpire Richard Illingworth given this out, Rohit signalled for DRS and technology saves him. Was the inswinger from Rabada and rapped the Indian opener on the front pad but there was an inside edge. He knew it and replays confirm the same. Having said that, Rabada continues to bowl in a fiery manner
reviews: Over 10.2: Review by India (Batting), Umpire - RK Illingworth, Batsman - RG Sharma (Upheld)

Commentary: Jadeja to Bavuma, no run, loud shout for LBW and then RJ thinks there might be bat there, somehow convinces Kohli into a review. It's a fair delivery, don't think there's any bat and I reckon the ball is spinning away from the stumps. UltraEdge confirms no bat/glove. It's a terrible review, the impact is miles outside off and India lose a review. This was tossed up outside off and spun away, Bavuma got a big stride across as he looked to lap and missed
reviews: Over 43.1: Review by India (Bowling), Umpire - CB Gaffaney, Batsman - T Bavuma (Struck down)

Commentary: Jadeja to Rabada, no run, in-turner, Rabada looks play against the break. The keeper takes it and there's an appeal for caught-behind. Not given and it's been challenged. Fair delivery. Spun a long way and it missed the inside edge by a long way. India have burnt a review here
reviews: Over 102.6: Review by India (Bowling), Umpire - NJ Llong, Batsman - K Rabada (Struck down)

Commentary: Shami to Anrich Nortje, no run, huge shout and up goes the finger. But Nortje instantly challenges the on-field call indicating that it's come off the forearm. Rapid heat from Shami, getting it to sprang up all of a sudden from the deck. Nortje is stunned by the extra bounce as he fails to counter it. UltraEdge is on and it comes to Nortje's rescue as it jars the forearm indeed. So, he survives. Good review from the batsman, he lives to fight another day
reviews: Over 9.5: Review by South Africa (Batting), Umpire - CB Gaffaney, Batsman - A Nortje (Upheld)

Commentary: Maharaj to Rahane, no run, Loud shout for LBW, Faf has a chat with his keeper and South Africa will review. It's a fair delivery, but did it pitch outside leg? No bat and UltraEdge confirms it. He's struck bang in front of middle, but the ball has pitched outside leg. South Africa will lose their first review. NOT OUT is the call. Lovely first delivery from Maharaj, tossed up from round the wicket, drifted in and then spun across the right-hander, opened up Rahane completely as he went back in defence
reviews: Over 100.1: Review by South Africa (Bowling), Umpire - CB Gaffaney, Batsman - AM Rahane (Struck down)

Commentary: Philander to Jadeja, no run, Review by SA for LBW! Skids through quickly from a good length spot, and has his bat and pad together in defence. There's a spike on UltraEdge when the ball passes the pad before getting to the bat. The third umpire is convinced it's pad first! Umpire's call on impact, wickets missing, and South Africa lose one review.
reviews: Over 52.6: Review by South Africa (Bowling), Umpire - RK Illingworth, Batsman - RA Jadeja (Struck down)

Commentary: Shami to Senuran Muthusamy, no run, was always a risky review from India who were clearly getting frustrated with the Protea defiance today. This was the in-angler from a good length, rapping Muthusamy on the pad in front of leg stump. Looked to be going down leg in real time and HawkEye confirms the same. Review lost!
reviews: Over 108.5: Review by India (Bowling), Umpire - CB Gaffaney, Batsman - S Muthusamy (Struck down)

Commentary: Ashwin to Rahim, no run, given out LBW and Rahim reviews successfully again. He tried the sweep shot, gloved it, so immediately signalled for the review and pointed at the glove. Impact looked plumb, ump didn't spot the glove
reviews: Over 30.5: Review by Bangladesh (Batting), Umpire - M Erasmus, Batsman - Mushfiqur Rahim (Upheld)

Commentary: U Yadav to Rahim, no run, even Umesh might have known as he started to abort from the appeal but by then umpire Erasmus had already raised the finger. Full and curling in, Rahim falls over while playing the flick and if not for the inside edge, he was a dead duck. Nonetheless, he was quick to challenge the decision and get it reversed
reviews: Over 16.3: Review by Bangladesh (Batting), Umpire - M Erasmus, Batsman - Mushfiqur Rahim (Upheld)

Commentary: Ishant to Rahim, leg byes, 1 run, highly optimistic LBW appeal and review from Ishant. Too much movement, Saha should have said no for the DRS. They were hoping to get away with umpire's call but ball-tracker says missing leg stump. Rahim is beaten on the flick by this big inswinger, impact on middle and leg, Ishant was adamant about the review. Most bowlers are
reviews: Over 8.3: Review by India (Bowling), Umpire - M Erasmus, Batsman - Mushfiqur Rahim (Struck down)

Commentary: Shami to Shadman Islam, no run, this is a brilliant decision from umpire Marais Erasmus. Shami ran in to get this short of length delivery to cut back in, Islam was beaten on the defence, clear sound and big deviation as well, it looked like a definite edge but Marais was so calm and shook his head. India had a chat and then reviewed. On the first replay, it was evident the bat was a long way away and it just went off the thigh pad. Islam looking behind also confused many. That was a stunning right-handed diving grab by Saha though
reviews: Over 7.2: Review by India (Bowling), Umpire - M Erasmus, Batsman - Shadman Islam (Struck down)

Commentary: Ishant to Kayes, no run, there was a sound as the ball passed the bat, so umpire Joel Wilson raised the finger. But Kayes was spontaneous in his review. He knew he didn't hit this. This short of length delivery moves away late and beats Kayes on the defence, flicked the back thigh en route to Saha. Good use of the review from Kayes
reviews: Over 6.1: Review by Bangladesh (Batting), Umpire - JS Wilson, Batsman - Imrul Kayes (Upheld)

Commentary: U Yadav to Mithun, no run, tailed in a long way and Mithun plays down the wrong line only to get rammed on the front pad. Umpire Marais Erasmus shook his head and in the end, he was proved right. The angle and excess movement took it down leg
reviews: Over 13.4: Review by India (Bowling), Umpire - M Erasmus, Batsman - Mohammad Mithun (Struck down)

Commentary: U Yadav to Mominul, no run, loud shout for LBW, did the ball come back enough to hit the stump? Anyway, India have decided to review. No shot offered, so the impact doesn't matter. It's a fair delivery. Don't think the ball has come back enough and ball-tracking confirms it. Good call from Erasmus, it's NOT OUT. India lose their first review, on a good length and just a hint of nip back into the left-hander, Mominul covered the line and then let it go, brushed the pads on its way to the keeper and that got the Indians excited
reviews: Over 5.5: Review by India (Bowling), Umpire - M Erasmus, Batsman - Mominul Haque (Struck down)

Commentary: Mehidy Hasan to Agarwal, no run, loud shout for LBW and Mayank has been given OUT LBW. he has a chat with his partner and wants a review. Was this sliding down leg? It's a fair delivery and looks like there's no bat on that, Mayank was struck pretty high on the pad, but he was in a squatting position. UltraEdge in and it confirms that there's no bat. Ball-tracking in, it's missing and Marais Erusmus will have to change his original decision. NOT OUT is the call. An agonising wait for Mayank who looked pretty shocked when he was given, the quicker off-break from Mehidy, Mayank was looking to sweep and was done in the pace of the delivery, the impact was in front of leg and would have been sailing down, would have been bouncing over the stumps as well - even if it wasn't going down. A rare bad call from Erasmus
reviews: Over 46.4: Review by India (Batting), Umpire - M Erasmus, Batsman - MA Agarwal (Upheld)

Commentary: Root to Wade, no run, that was full, turned a bit after landing in the rough and went to the slip fielder. The umpire felt there was an edge and gave it out but the ball missed the bat and instead hit the ground to create the noise. Wade in the end survives after reviewing it
reviews: Over 71.1: Review by Australia (Batting), Umpire - HDPK Dharmasena, Batsman - MS Wade (Upheld)

Commentary: Jofra Archer to Wade, no run, England review -- Okay, Wade is undone by the pace here as he falls over on the flick and is struck on the front pad. There's no doubt that it's hitting the stumps, but then, it's pitching down leg, comfortably. It was always going to be dodgy with these over the wicket angles to left-handers
reviews: Over 48.6: Review by England (Bowling), Umpire - M Erasmus, Batsman - MS Wade (Struck down)

Commentary: Jofra Archer to Paine, no run, caught at short leg. Marais Erasmus is unmoved. England review. Clearly, no bat. Even UltraEdge isn't needed. Over to HawkEye now. Comfortably missing leg. England have burnt a review here. Bad call to send it upstairs. A pacy in-slanter and Paine is beaten for pace as he looks to work it through the leg-side, misses the inside edge and pings the front leg before going into the hands of the short leg fielder
reviews: Over 44.1: Review by England (Bowling), Umpire - M Erasmus, Batsman - TD Paine (Struck down)

Commentary: Hazlewood to Rory Burns, no run .. and to cap up what was a near-top-notch umpiring day, umpire Dharmasena decides to uphold what his predecessors have done all series -- get reversed on DRS. It's hard to sympathise with this one, one that gave Australia a one-minute false hope with Hazlewood seeming to have trapped Burns LBW. Only to be reviewed, and found out that the ball had easily pitched down leg and was probably too high too
reviews: Over 3.6: Review by England (Batting), Umpire - HDPK Dharmasena, Batsman - RJ Burns (Upheld)

Commentary: Woakes to Wade, no run, So England review an LBW. Clearly nobody's trusting the umpires any longer. Wade's trapped on the back foot as this one nips in, beats his inside edge and smashes him on the front pad. But, but, it's high on the flap -- and HawkEye shows him to have shuffled across a little too much, striking him on umpire's call with the line of off, and then angling away and missing
reviews: Over 32.3: Review by England (Bowling), Umpire - HDPK Dharmasena, Batsman - MS Wade (Struck down)

Commentary: Mitchell Marsh to Buttler, no run, an appeal for caught-down-the-leg-side. Not given and Australia decide to review. Fair delivery. A back of a length delivery on the ribs and Buttler missed the tuck. Clearly no inside edge  and the on-field call stays. Australia have burned a review here. It clipped the thigh pad before going into the mitts of the keeper
reviews: Over 57.1: Review by Australia (Bowling), Umpire - M Erasmus, Batsman - JC Buttler (Struck down)

Commentary: Hazlewood to Rory Burns, no run, that was always going to be a dubious call and Rory Burns survives. That was missing the sticks as HawyEye showed it was going over. The ball hit the batter on the thigh pad and despite bing on the back leg, Burns was very sure of the fact that he wasn't out and reviewed immediately
reviews: Over 3.3: Review by England (Batting), Umpire - M Erasmus, Batsman - RJ Burns (Upheld)

Commentary: Pat Cummins to Buttler, no run, good length ball outside off, Buttler lifts his bat and lets it go
reviews: Over 42.3: Review by England (Bowling), Umpire - M Erasmus, Batsman - MA Starc (Struck down)

Commentary: Hazlewood to Denly, FOUR, shot! Full and outside off, Denly leans forward and drives it on the rise through cover. A dangerous shot to play but Denly usually fancies himself on the drive and this time he was able to middle it
reviews: Over 31.5: Review by England (Bowling), Umpire - HDPK Dharmasena, Batsman - MS Wade (Struck down)

Commentary: Starc to Denly, no run, angled across the off-stump, Denly prods forward and defends it to backward point
reviews: Over 6.1: Review by Australia (Batting), Umpire - M Erasmus, Batsman - MS Harris (Struck down)

Commentary: Lyon to Jofra Archer, no run, flighted delivery on off, Archer stays back as he defends
reviews: Over 91.3: Review by England (Batting), Umpire - HDPK Dharmasena, Batsman - C Overton (Struck down)

Commentary: Pat Cummins to Bairstow, no run, fuller length delivery and holding its line outside off, has Bairstow pushing forward and beats him on the outside edge
reviews: Over 76.1: Review by Australia (Bowling), Umpire - M Erasmus, Batsman - C Overton (Struck down)

Commentary: Hazlewood to Root, no run, all four balls have been almost on similar lengths - back of a length and Root is quite at home with that, he's back and across to block it down the wicket
reviews: Over 62.5: Review by England (Batting), Umpire - M Erasmus, Batsman - C Overton (Upheld)

Commentary: Root to Starc, 1 run, that's a top decision from umpire Marais Erasmus. It was a real feather and he managed to spot that. Sliding on from round the wicket and Starc goes for the paddle, he was struck in-line but that was after the ball had brushed the glove
reviews: Over 119.3: Review by England (Bowling), Umpire - M Erasmus, Batsman - MA Starc (Struck down)

Commentary: Pat Cummins to Jack Leach, no run, leg-lined yorker. Leach can't lay bat, but it's pitching clearly down leg as he gets pinned on the front leg. There's barely an appeal, but when desperation hits, why not kill time in reviewing. So the Aussies do, and it's clearly pitching a foot down
reviews: Over 123.6: Review by Australia (Bowling), Umpire - CB Gaffaney, Batsman - MJ Leach (Struck down)

Commentary: Hazlewood to Bairstow, no run, Bairstow given out caught behind but reviews spontaneously. Just a little too flashy against a ball that came in with the angle and cramped him for room. But he's missed it, there's no edge. Loud cheers. It was through him before the bat came across. Maybe has to temper his aggression a touch. It's worked wonders so far, but it'll help to be more selective. This wasn't a ball to cut
reviews: Over 97.1: Review by England (Batting), Umpire - CB Gaffaney, Batsman - JM Bairstow (Upheld)

Commentary: Lyon to Denly, no run, this time Australia have gone for the review, but ball-tracking shows that it's comfortably turning down leg. Denly's hit on the pad again but he's well forward and the turn is significant. Not a smart review
reviews: Over 58.4: Review by Australia (Bowling), Umpire - JS Wilson, Batsman - JL Denly (Struck down)

Commentary: Hazlewood to Root, no run, looks like an inside edge on this, but it's been given out! An in-tilter, 86.4mph|139kph, seaming back in, Root is trapped on the crease, gets a massive inside edge onto the thigh. Massive inside edge and the decision has to be overturned.
reviews: Over 51.2: Review by England (Batting), Umpire - CB Gaffaney, Batsman - JE Root (Upheld)

Commentary: Stokes to Labuschagne, no run, And now Labuschagne reviews umpire Gaffaney. It was a nibbler going down leg, which Labuschagne in looking to tickle, tickles through to the keeper? Well, he doesn't think so. Challenges the onfield call, and redeems himself with the UltraEdge showing a spike as the ball goes past the thigh pad
reviews: Over 38.2: Review by Australia (Batting), Umpire - CB Gaffaney, Batsman - M Labuschagne (Upheld)

Commentary: Broad to Marcus Harris, no run, and I'm sure they're going for the review. Yep, they are! An LBW shout, and it looked plumb! Not a no-ball. The seam wobbles, beats the inside edge, flat line on UltraEdge as the in-seamer beats the inside edge. Struck in line but that's seaming in too much from round the wicket - misses the leg-stump. A good decision by Mr. Wilson. My bad!
reviews: Over 7.4: Review by England (Bowling), Umpire - JS Wilson, Batsman - MS Harris (Struck down)

Commentary: Hazlewood to Denly, no run, reviewed, after it's given out! Skids through, seemed to hurry from a good length, beaten by the inward seam movement, past the inside edge - hits him on the back-leg, impact on middle and off, and ball-tracking shows that it's flying over the stumps! A long way over! Not out it is, but can't say I blame Wilson for this one!
reviews: Over 5.5: Review by England (Batting), Umpire - JS Wilson, Batsman - JL Denly (Upheld)

Commentary: Broad to Warner, no run, Warner's given out caught behind but he has reviewed straightaway. UltraEdge vindicates him. Nothing but a more-or-less flat line. Was an excellent delivery from Broad who got it to swing away late from round the wicket. Warner, tempted by the full length, committed himself on the drive but was beaten
reviews: Over 30.5: Review by Australia (Batting), Umpire - CB Gaffaney, Batsman - DA Warner (Upheld)

Commentary: Jack Leach to Pat Cummins, no run, just a speculative review from Root. From over the wicket, this is clearly spinning away from off stump as Cummins pads up to it. Missing comfortably
reviews: Over 45.4: Review by England (Bowling), Umpire - Aleem Dar, Batsman - PJ Cummins (Struck down)

Commentary: Woakes to Labuschagne, no run, it nipped back in sharply off the deck, Labuschagne was squared up totally, it beats his edge and strikes him on the pads. The umpire was not interested, Root took the matter upstairs but was proved wrong as the impact was outside off
reviews: Over 25.1: Review by England (Bowling), Umpire - Aleem Dar, Batsman - M Labuschagne (Struck down)

Commentary: Hazlewood to Stokes, no run, a desperate review from Australia. Took it with just a second left. There was no excitement when the appeal was made for some of them suspected an inside edge and inside edge it was. Stokes shuffled down the pitch and eked out a fine edge onto his pad before falling across on the on-drive. Paine had a long chat with his bowler and went up for it almost reluctantly
reviews: Over 40.1: Review by Australia (Bowling), Umpire - CB Gaffaney, Batsman - BA Stokes (Struck down)

Commentary: Jofra Archer to Pat Cummins, no run, England review: Fair delivery and it's missed everything. Nothing on the UltraEdge either. The onfield verdict will stay. A fiery bumper outside off, forces Cummins into a tangle on the hop as he tries to fend that, escapes past the elbow guard and carries to the keeper. There was some sound as the ball passed the bat, but there was no contact. Absolutely nothing. England felt they had him and went up for the review straightaway...
reviews: Over 72.3: Review by England (Bowling), Umpire - Aleem Dar, Batsman - PJ Cummins (Struck down)

Commentary: Jofra Archer to Pat Cummins, no ball, Jofra Archer's overstepped! Full delivery on off and Cummins blocks it into the off-side
reviews: Over 72.3: Review by England (Bowling), Umpire - Aleem Dar, Batsman - PJ Cummins (Struck down)

Commentary: Stokes to Wade, no run, Wade looked all at sea against the balls that swung away from him and this one was no different and had this not pitched outside leg Wade was a dead duck. He tries to flick a full delivery and plays all around it, gets beaten on the inside edge and it did look dead to the naked eye
reviews: Over 35.6: Review by Australia (Batting), Umpire - CB Gaffaney, Batsman - MS Wade (Upheld)

Commentary: Smith to Bairstow, no run, this looks like another waste of a review from Australia. Yes, well wide of the stumps. Bairstow shoulders arms to a slider which brushes his front pad on the way through. It has Paine and Smith excited, but it's not coming back enough
reviews: Over 57.5: Review by Australia (Bowling), Umpire - CB Gaffaney, Batsman - JM Bairstow (Struck down)

Commentary: Lyon to Denly, no run, never looked out did it? Missing by a fair distance down the leg-side. It was on pitched on a slightly fuller length and Denly wasn't fully forward to it, tries to work it with the spin and gets beaten on the inside edge. The appeal wasn't strong but Lyon had a chat with his skipper and the latter went up straightaway....
reviews: Over 15.6: Review by Australia (Bowling), Umpire - CB Gaffaney, Batsman - JL Denly (Struck down)

Commentary: Siddle to Moeen Ali, no run, Australia have lost one review. The ball decks in sharply and beats Ali on the inside edge, the ball hit him above the kneeroll and the height was always going to be the issue. Ball-tracking confirmed it was, umpire Wilson getting a few back now
reviews: Over 44.4: Review by Australia (Bowling), Umpire - JS Wilson, Batsman - MM Ali (Struck down)

Commentary: Siddle to Root, no run, #15: Root has taken another review, Wilson has to overturn his decision again. Got to feel for the umpire here, matters getting worse for him. This length delivery kept a touch low and the batsman got a huge inside edge as he tried to defend it. It didn't even need UltraEdge to confirm the same - it was such a huge deflection. Second time this morning, an lbw decision has been overturned by Root, courtesy DRS
reviews: Over 16.4: Review by England (Batting), Umpire - JS Wilson, Batsman - JE Root (Upheld)

Commentary: Pattinson to Root, no run, Root has been adjudged lbw, and he's decided to the challenge the decision. I'll tell you what! This is the 14th wrong decision of the match, 9th one for Joel Wilson. Has been a nightmare for both the umpires as the decision has to be overturned. Was a length delivery around middle and leg, Root got beaten on his flick and pinned on the pads. The impact was umpire's call and when that happens, it's mostly going to slide down the leg side. Root survives!
reviews: Over 12.6: Review by England (Batting), Umpire - JS Wilson, Batsman - JE Root (Upheld)

Commentary: Moeen Ali to Paine, no run, review time. England clearly have good reason to challenge umpire Dar's possible sixth blunder in this game -- but no, he'll stay on five for now. So Paine wasn't playing a shot to an in-spinning delivery from outside off, kicking it away with his right pad that was very deep in his crease. Sure there was big turn, but apparently not enough, missing off by a couple of inches
reviews: Over 97.6: Review by England (Bowling), Umpire - Aleem Dar, Batsman - TD Paine (Struck down)

Commentary: Broad to Wade, no run, blunder #12. Umpire Wilson has taken a lead now. Him - 7 | Aleem Dar - 5. Decks in sharply from a length and Wade is caught on the shuffle, he falls over and is beaten on the inside edge. The impact is above the pad and almost at the bottom of the thigh pad, hence Wade knew it was going over and went up straightaway
reviews: Over 84.2: Review by Australia (Batting), Umpire - JS Wilson, Batsman - MS Wade (Upheld)

Commentary: Moeen Ali to Smith, no run, appeal. And England will take matters upstairs. It's Smith after all, and it's umpire Wilson after all. So Ali's gotten this one to spin in past Smith's forward defence -- but alas, HawkEye tells us there's a little too much of it, heading easily down leg
reviews: Over 74.5: Review by England (Bowling), Umpire - JS Wilson, Batsman - SPD Smith (Struck down)

Commentary: Pattinson to Rory Burns, no run, big LBW ask -- And the Aussies ain't trusting these umpires any longer. They go up when it isn't given .. and it's pitching comfortably down leg. Ah, redemption, ump Wilson! Burns is trapped in the crease, but this over the wicket angle is always going to be dodgy
reviews: Over 82.2: Review by Australia (Bowling), Umpire - JS Wilson, Batsman - RJ Burns (Struck down)

Commentary: Siddle to Root, no run, and we have a blunder #10 -- 5-5 for each of them. Umpire Dar catches up, giving an LBW that could never be, thanks to Root's review and the UltraEdge showing up a big fat inside edge onto the front pad. A more than decent enough delivery though, cutting in off the seam and striking Root almost-plumb
reviews: Over 33.2: Review by England (Batting), Umpire - Aleem Dar, Batsman - JE Root (Upheld)

Commentary: Pattinson to Root, no run, Root has been adjudged caught behind and he's decided to challenge the decision straight away. There was a certain sound but it was off the ball kissing the off-stump. Not for the first time have we seen the bails not getting dislodged - saw that on a numerous occasions during the World Cup. Was a sharp length ball around off and kept straight, perfect delivery that beat Root on his back foot defence. He's still out in the middle as DRS comes to his rescue. Root watches the replay and has a cheeky smile on his face, lucky escape
reviews: Over 20.6: Review by England (Batting), Umpire - JS Wilson, Batsman - JE Root (Upheld)

Commentary: Broad to Smith, no run, England's LBW review. So Smith shuffles as usual, looks to whip this full one through mid-wicket, but the ball drifts in more than he'd anticipated to pin him on the front pad. And when there's a review about to be wasted, why not officially waste it -- Root takes it upstairs, and it's easily down leg
reviews: Over 74.2: Review by England (Bowling), Umpire - JS Wilson, Batsman - NM Lyon (Struck down)

Commentary: Woakes to Siddle, no run, Here's the 7th wrong decision of the day! Umpires are in the hot seat today. Umpire Wilson raises his finger but there's a huge inside edge on that. Was angled into the batsman by Woakes and Siddle got an inside edge on to his pads as he tried to flick it into the leg side. The batsman went up straightaway and DRS comes to his rescue
reviews: Over 46.1: Review by Australia (Batting), Umpire - JS Wilson, Batsman - PM Siddle (Upheld)

Commentary: Broad to Smith, no run, the leave of doom .. shuffling and then leaving a delivery that comes back in just enough to rap him on the front knee. Now the umpire's convinced, but Smith is quick to disagree. Remember, the impact will not matter here as Smith wasn't even close to playing a shot. But, but, HawkEye shows it's just not coming back in enough - missing off. Ahh, the umpiring today ..
reviews: Over 33.5: Review by Australia (Batting), Umpire - Aleem Dar, Batsman - SPD Smith (Upheld)

Commentary: Broad to Warner, no run, England take a review against Warner! They're not excited though, as it could probably be umpire's call. Broad had his hands on the head but this might go in favor of the batsman as he's standing way outside his crease. It's missing, in fact. Warner looked to defend this one off his toes but got beaten for pace. The impact was in line but the ball was sailing over the stumps. Umpire's decision stays as it is and England have lost one review
reviews: Over 3.1: Review by England (Bowling), Umpire - Aleem Dar, Batsman - DA Warner (Struck down)

Commentary: Hazlewood to Masood, no run, Paine thinks there is an edge and he has gone for a review.  Bat seems to have come down after the ball has passed and it looks like an another ordinary review from Tim Paine and Australia. Nothing on the hotSpot and on-field decision will stay. Australia lose a review.  It was drifting down the leg-side, Masood was late on the flick. It clips his thigh pad and ends up into the gloves of Paine. The slip cordon advised Paine to take the review, which he did and he was proved wrong within minutes
reviews: Over 11.2: Review by Australia (Bowling), Umpire - RK Illingworth, Batsman - Shan Masood (Struck down)

Commentary: Starc to Yasir Shah, no run, it's referred by Paine! Yasir Shah might have nicked this down the leg-side. 139.9km/h. Hotspot on the trouser, nothing on the bat. Nothing on Snicko either. And that's not out. Both reviews gone for the Aussies.
reviews: Over 33.1: Review by Australia (Bowling), Umpire - MA Gough, Batsman - Yasir Shah (Struck down)

Commentary: Pat Cummins to Imam, no run, 135.3kph, good length delivery, Imam-ul-Haq looks to play across the line and misses it. Wears it on the pad and Australia went up in unison for an lbw appeal. The Australians after a big conversation decided to go upstairs. Pitched outside leg and Australia have burnt a review in the second over
reviews: Over 1.1: Review by Australia (Bowling), Umpire - MA Gough, Batsman - Imam-ul-Haq (Struck down)

Commentary: Starc to Masood, no run, Masood has been adjudged lbw. Walks down the pitch, talks with his batting partner and decides to review. Fair delivery. There's a mark on HotSpot. So, umpire Richard Illingworth has to reverse his call. Successful review for Pakistan. A pacy in-angler at 147.8kph from a good length and Masood was late to close his bat-face, fortunately got an inside edge. The impact was adjacent to the sticks. Superb over from Starc - a maiden
reviews: Over 0.6: Review by Pakistan (Batting), Umpire - RK Illingworth, Batsman - Shan Masood (Upheld)

Commentary: Shaheen Afridi to Wade, no run, Pakistan have gone for a caught behind review.  This looks close. There was some sound for sure but was it off bat hitting the pad? There is a flat line on the snicko and the original decision will stay.  Pakistan have lost both their reviews now. It was a length delivery around off, it straightens off the deck, Wade ends up playing inside the line. It defeats his outside edge and goes into the gloves of Rizwan. Pakistan challenged the umpire's decision but they were proved wrong withion minutes
reviews: Over 111.4: Review by Pakistan (Bowling), Umpire - RK Illingworth, Batsman - MS Wade (Struck down)

Commentary: Yasir Shah to Warner, 1 run, Pakistan have gone for a lbw review. Warner attempts the sweep on this delivery which was very full, doesn't connect it as he would have liked. But got an inside edge and that saved him. Pakistan are desperate for a wicket so they went upstairs but there optimism couldn't buy them a wicket as there was a clear inside edge!
reviews: Over 66.4: Review by Pakistan (Bowling), Umpire - MA Gough, Batsman - DA Warner (Struck down)

Commentary: Yasir Shah to Labuschagne, no run, Marnus Labuschagne has been given out lbw and he's reviewed it straightaway. Fair delivery and there seems to be an inside edge involved. Oh yes! Clear mark on Hotspot as the ball passes the bat and we don't need an UltraEdge to confirm that. Telly umpire asks umpire Richard Illingworth to reverse his verdict. Not out. Labuschagne strides forward to this skiddy slider and got a healthy inside edge onto pad, the appeal was instant and so was the decision, but Labuschagne knew he's safe and didn't even bother walking up to his partner
reviews: Over 103.2: Review by Australia (Batting), Umpire - RK Illingworth, Batsman - M Labuschagne (Upheld)

Commentary: Haris Sohail to Warner, no run, turning down leg, terrible delivery and Warner went for the sweep and missed it. The keeper realized late that there was a little sound as the ball went past the bat and appealed. The skipper also decided to review it. The replays don't seem to show an edge so Warner should survive this. Snicko shows a line as flat as a pool table. Review lost. Poor one indeed from Pakistan to have taken that review
reviews: Over 75.4: Review by Pakistan (Bowling), Umpire - RK Illingworth, Batsman - DA Warner (Struck down)

Commentary: Bumrah to Darren Bravo, out Lbw!! 50th Test wicket for Jasprit Bumrah. He was the most economical bowler for India thus far and the reward was always coming. Went wide of the crease and angled it into the left-hander, Bravo tries to shuffle across on the flick and gets caught in the crease. It pins him just below the knee roll and umpire Richard Kettleborough puts his finger up after a brief deliberation. Hitting the top of leg peg. Windies lose a review. Darren Bravo lbw b Bumrah 18(27) [4s-2 6s-1]
reviews: Over 29.1: Review by West Indies (Batting), Umpire - RA Kettleborough, Batsman - DM Bravo (Struck down)

Commentary: Roach to Agarwal, out Caught by Shai Hope!! Another cracker and West Indies are confident that Mayank has edged it. Kettleborough says NO and we have a review. There was a sound as the ball went past the bat, UltraEdge suggests that it came from the bat. 'Richard, we have a spike on the bat', says Paul Reiffel and the decision has been changed. Mayank is OUT. Terrific bowling from Roach, he loves this ground, his 26th Test wicket at North Sound. Beautifully bowled once again, pitched up and came with the angle, made Mayank push forward before it straightened, enough to find the outside edge and Hope does the rest. Fair to say this was coming - both batsmen were struggling to cope with Roach's angle. Agarwal c Shai Hope b Roach 5(13) [4s-1]
reviews: Over 4.2: Review by West Indies (Bowling), Umpire - RA Kettleborough, Batsman - MA Agarwal (Upheld)

Commentary: Southee to Karunaratne, out Lbw!! Karunaratne has been given lbw as he hasn't offered a shot. The skipper decides to challenge the onfield call, but to no avail. A brain fade for the captain and Southee is the beneficiary - achieves the feat of 250 Test wickets. Has been a memorable Test for both - Southee and Boult. They've got to the 250-wicket mark in the same match. This was speared into the batsman from round the wicket and the left hander didn't offer a shot, keeping his bat behind the pads, was a touch late to play it. Though the impact was well outside off, it had enough movement to shape in and rock the off-stump. Indecision, dilemma - the cause behind his downfall. Just the wicket the Kiwis were looking for. They can now possibly trigger a batting collapse, possibly. Karunaratne lbw b Southee 21(70) [4s-2]
reviews: Over 43.5: Review by Sri Lanka (Batting), Umpire - BNJ Oxenford, Batsman - FDM Karunaratne (Struck down)

Commentary: Southee to Lasith Embuldeniya, out Lbw!! Embuldeniya has been adjudged lbw and he's decided to challenge the call. Looks very close, probably hitting the leg stump. It's hitting middle and leg. And the onfield decision stays. A fine delivery by Southee, this. Pitches on middle and jags in ever so slightly, the batsman gets beaten due to the movement and is pinned right in front of the middle stump. Replays confirm three reds and the batsman will have to make his way back to the pavilion. Tim needs only a wicket more to complete his 5-for. Can he do it? Lasith Embuldeniya lbw b Southee 0(2)
reviews: Over 85.1: Review by Sri Lanka (Batting), Umpire - MA Gough, Batsman - L Embuldeniya (Struck down)

Commentary: Somerville to Thirimanne, out Lbw!! Loud shout for LBW and New Zealand want a review. Did it straighten enough? It's a fair delivery, no bat on that and UltraEdge confirms it. Hawk-Eye in: It's three REDS and New Zealand have broken through, Thirimanne is OUT. A very good review from the visitors, but did they have any other option? Can they cash in on this opening? Thirimanne falls after a fine knock, a superb partnership has been broken. This was the off-break from round the wicket, Thirimanne went down on his knees as he looked to sweep. The ball pitched around leg and did straighten, once the batsmen missed, he was always going to be in trouble, crashing into the leg-stump and Illingworth has to change his decision. Thirimanne lbw b Somerville 64(163) [4s-4]
reviews: Over 60.2: Review by New Zealand (Bowling), Umpire - RK Illingworth, Batsman - HDRL Thirimanne (Upheld)

Commentary: Dhananjaya de Silva to Ajaz Patel, out Lbw!! That looked straight and Ajaz has been given OUT LBW. With a review on offer, he decides to take a chance. Hold on, is it a no-ball? 'Very tight', says Bruce Oxenford. On second view, he deems it as a fair delivery. Clearly no bat, ball-tracking coming up. Three REDS and it will stay OUT. Sri Lanka need 268 to win. The frustration is finally over for the hosts - this was tossed up outside off and spun back in, stayed a bit low and struck Ajaz right in front of off, was going on and crashing into the middle-stump. Ajaz Patel lbw b Dhananjaya de Silva 14(23) [4s-1]
reviews: Over 105.6: Review by New Zealand (Batting), Umpire - MA Gough, Batsman - AY Patel (Struck down)

Commentary: Somerville to Lasith Embuldeniya, out Lbw!! That looked plumb right through. But Embuldeniya just wanted to take a chance. The slider that drifts in with the round the wicket angle, Embuldeniya kneels down to play the sweep and misses it, beaten for pace and struck on the back thigh. The impact was in-line and it was going on to smash middle-stump. Somerville finishes with three wickets. Lasith Embuldeniya lbw b Somerville 5(17) [4s-1]
reviews: Over 93.2: Review by Sri Lanka (Batting), Umpire - RK Illingworth, Batsman - L Embuldeniya (Struck down)

Commentary: Dananjaya to Henry Nicholls, out Lbw!! Nicholls has been given out LBW and he wants a review. It's a fair delivery, is there any bat on that? Was it spinning past the off-stump? Bruce Oxenford wants the UltraEdge and there's clear daylight between bat, glove and the ball. Pitching in line, the impact is in line and it's hitting middle and leg. Three REDS and Nicholls is OUT. Fourth wicket for Dananjaya and he's on a roll - this was tossed up around leg and then straightened a tad, Nicholls was down on the knees as he looked to sweep, beaten by the extra bounce that Dananjaya procures - struck on the back-thigh, the impact was in front of middle and would have been crashing into the middle and leg stump. Umpire Illingworth got it spot on and New Zealand have lost their first review. Henry Nicholls lbw b Dananjaya 42(78) [4s-2]
reviews: Over 58.2: Review by New Zealand (Batting), Umpire - RK Illingworth, Batsman - HM Nicholls (Struck down)

Commentary: Shami to du Plessis, out Lbw!! Shami's planning pays off finally. Went wide of the crease on two occasions prior to this against Faf. Both were fullish outswingers, one that was left alone and then saw one just beating the SA skipper's outside edge. On this occasion, the length is slightly shorter and the line is straighter as well. Faf gets pinned on the crease and is late to react as this straightens off the deck just a fraction to rap him on the back pad. The lower bounce didn't help either and it looked stone dead in real time. The umpire wasted no time in raising his finger but Faf, perhaps in desperation, went for the review. Was always going to be in trouble if he didn't hit this and UltraEdge confirms that he hasn't. As plumb as it gets. SA falling apart quickly once again. du Plessis lbw b Shami 4(10)
reviews: Over 6.6: Review by South Africa (Batting), Umpire - NJ Llong, Batsman - F du Plessis (Struck down)

Commentary: Nadeem to Anrich Nortje, out Lbw!! Only an inside edge could have saved Nortje there. He was struck plumb in front. The slider which skids on, Nortje presses forward and is beaten by the in-drift, the ball strikes him in front of middle and ball-tracking shows it to be going on to crash into leg-stump. Anrich Nortje lbw b Nadeem 4(55)
reviews: Over 56.2: Review by South Africa (Batting), Umpire - RK Illingworth, Batsman - A Nortje (Struck down)

Commentary: Rabada to Pujara, out Lbw!! You could see this coming to be honest. Pujara is generally never comfortable against the in-coming ball, especially if it's at high pace and especially if the pacer has variations up his sleeve. Like Rabada does. He has been phenomenal this morning and this is another classical setup. The two-card trick, juggles between the outswinger and inswinger, and it's the latter that gets rid of Pujara. He wasn't that forward to this and looked to defend with a gap between bat and pad. The movement ensured that he was beaten on the inside edge and rapped on the back pad. Seemed dead plumb in real time and Faf was quick to review it. Works in SA's favor. Unless Pujara had got any bat, he was always a goner on this. Pujara lbw b Rabada 0(9)
reviews: Over 8.3: Review by South Africa (Bowling), Umpire - RK Illingworth, Batsman - CA Pujara (Upheld)

Commentary: Jadeja to Maharaj, out Lbw!! Final blow has been dealt by Jadeja. It was the quicker delivery, goes straight on and Maharaj is caught in the crease which led to his downfall. It crashes onto the pad in front of middle and only height was a factor that could've saved him. Tried his luck and took the review but in vain. A victory by an innings and 137 runs for India. As comprehensive as it gets. Maharaj lbw b Jadeja 22(65) [4s-3]
reviews: Over 67.2: Review by South Africa (Batting), Umpire - CB Gaffaney, Batsman - KA Maharaj (Struck down)

Commentary: Ashwin to Rabada, out Lbw!! Rabada has been adjudged lbw. And, he reviews. Fair delivery. No bat. Was it straightening enough to hit the sticks? Hitting leg and umpire Chris Gaffaney's on-field call stays. A floaty ball that drifted in and Rabada ended up playing down the wrong line trying to block. The ball straightened ever so lightly before striking the batter's front pad adjacent to leg. The ball-tracking shows it to be crashing into leg-stump. Ashwin finishes with four wickets and it's also stumps on day three. Rabada lbw b Ashwin 2(9)
reviews: Over 105.4: Review by South Africa (Batting), Umpire - CB Gaffaney, Batsman - K Rabada (Struck down)

Commentary: Jadeja to Senuran Muthusamy, out Lbw!! First dismissal for Senuran Muthusamy in Tests and he is out LBW because he offered no shot. That turned in from the rough and he was caught in the crease. There was a lot of spin on it but umpire Llong deemed it out and he was right as Hawkeye showed three reds. The impact was outside off but was taken out of the equation as he offered no shot. India breakthrough again. The umpire had a keen look and really took his time to deem him out. Senuran Muthusamy lbw b Jadeja 7(20)
reviews: Over 44.2: Review by South Africa (Batting), Umpire - NJ Llong, Batsman - S Muthusamy (Struck down)

Commentary: Shami to Bavuma, out Caught by W Saha!! India review: Loud, pleading appeal for a caught-behind but umpire Chris Gaffaney is unmoved which has forced them to take the DRS. They are pretty confident and it's because there's a tiny edge. UltraEdge confirms it showing a spike. So, Bavuma doesn't last long. India continue to land punches here. Shami gets a wicket off his first delivery, couldn't have asked for a better start. But what a snorter of a delivery that was. Rears up off a length, luring Bavuma to feel for it before biting the outside edge. That bounce undid the batsman and the body language of Bavuma suggested that he did nick it behind. Anyway, the hosts are overjoyed, why not! Bavuma c W Saha b Shami 8(15) [4s-1]
reviews: Over 9.1: Review by India (Bowling), Umpire - CB Gaffaney, Batsman - T Bavuma (Upheld)

Commentary: Jadeja to Philander, out Lbw!! Philander played all around this. He sees the ball pitch around leg stump and looks to protect his pads with an angled bat - something you're not advised to do against spinners anywhere in the world, but Philander does just that and finds himself plumb lbw. Tries to cover for the angle but the ball spins big and slams him dead on the back pad. Umpire Chris Gaffaney gave it a long thought and shook his head in disapproval because there were doubts - if it pitched in line/was it spinning too much to miss off. Kohli had a word with RJ and signalled the review instantly. DRS shows ball pitching in-line, striking a good part of the off stump Philander lbw b Jadeja 0(3)
reviews: Over 26.4: Review by India (Bowling), Umpire - CB Gaffaney, Batsman - VD Philander (Upheld)

Commentary: Jadeja to Elgar, out Lbw!! Jadeja wheels away in his celebrappeal, absolutely convinced. But the umpire's finger remains unmoved. India are surely going to review this. It just looked out. Only thing to check was whether it pitched outside leg but - as ball-tracking shows - it hasn't. Cue the roars from the Indian players. Massive wicket to get rid of the first innings centurion so early. Skidded on from round the wicket, stayed low, went under Elgar's bat and trapped him right in front. Elgar lbw b Jadeja 2(16)
reviews: Over 3.3: Review by India (Bowling), Umpire - RK Illingworth, Batsman - D Elgar (Upheld)

Commentary: Philander to Pujara, out Lbw! Philander doesn't bother to appeal, that's how plumb that was! Pujara has reviewed this! NO WAY! Impact in line, hitting top of off-stump - O.U.T.!, as this straightener off the seam beats the leading edge of his would-be glance to strike him plumb in front, sealing his fate for the game. An unplayable delivery - that's the requirement to get Pujara out, and Philander has produced just that. Phenomenal bowling. Pujara lbw b Philander 81(148) [4s-13 6s-2]
reviews: Over 50.6: Review by India (Batting), Umpire - RK Illingworth, Batsman - CA Pujara (Struck down)

Commentary: Ashwin to Rabada, out Lbw!! Huge appeal for lbw and India have reviewed this. Legal delivery and its three reds. No hiding for Rabada this time around. Waits deep inside the crease hoping to stay leg-side of the offbreak, the skiddy slider though comes in much quicker and pings him just below the knee roll in line with leg-stump. It seemed a bit dicey to the naked eye but replays suggest it did just enough to hold its line and paint the top of leg peg. Ashwin ends with a seven-fer and India have a lead of 71. Rabada lbw b Ashwin 15(17) [4s-3]
reviews: Over 131.2: Review by India (Bowling), Umpire - RK Illingworth, Batsman - K Rabada (Upheld)

Commentary: Ishant to Kayes, out Lbw!! This looked so out. Really good decision from Joel Wilson. Was under pressure after caught behind decision was reversed. But kept his cool, gave it a long thought and raised the finger. This is the new variety from Ishant, the leg-cutter that comes out scrambled seam and then cuts back in/holds its line from round the wicket. He's set Kayes with away-swingers and then slipped this in. Kayes's head was outside the line and he missed the ball completely looking to play to leg. Impact in line with middle and leg and given. He spoke to Shadman Islam and then sent the case upstairs, only to lose a review as ball-tracker says crashing leg pole. India get their first wicket. Kayes lbw b Ishant 4(15)
reviews: Over 6.3: Review by Bangladesh (Batting), Umpire - JS Wilson, Batsman - Imrul Kayes (Struck down)

Commentary: Shami to Mominul, out Lbw!! Huge appeal from Shami for lbw, umpire Rod Tucker ain't too interested and rejects it. Shami is so convinced that he walks up to his skipper asking him to go for the review. This looked really close on first viewing. Not a no-ball. Flat line on the UltraEdge. Over to ball-tracking.. Three reds and it predicts that the ball is going to smash the leg-stump. That escalated pretty quickly, ain't it? Shami is showing why he's a different beast when it comes to the second innings. It was the pacer, who persuaded Kohli to take the review and he's spot on. This cut back in from a length, Mominul was going nowhere after shuffling a bit and getting chained in the crease. Unable to combat the movement, gets rapped on the pad around the knee-roll. It looked plumb and there you go! Three down now are Bangladesh and it's all going downhill for the visitors. Mominul lbw b Shami 7(20) [4s-1]
reviews: Over 12.5: Review by India (Bowling), Umpire - RJ Tucker, Batsman - Mominul Haque (Upheld)

Commentary: Abu Jayed to Kohli, out Lbw!! Length delivery nipped in and Kohli ended up playing across the line a bit. Abu Jayed appealed and convinced his skipper to take the review. And the replays certainly painted a more concerned picture for Kohli as it looked close. HawkEye cleared the picture and showed us three reds. The skipper is gone for a rare duck as Bangladesh fight back. That was a lovely delivery though. Unassuming one which caught the Indian skipper by surprise. The footwork also wasn't up to the mark and that plotted his downfall. Kohli lbw b Abu Jayed 0(2)
reviews: Over 31.5: Review by Bangladesh (Bowling), Umpire - RJ Tucker, Batsman - V Kohli (Upheld)

Commentary: Jack Leach to Paine, out Lbw!! Paine leaves his way to his doom. And 2-2 tonight is a reality again. He goes back deep in the crease to a delivery he should ideally have been forward to, and then surprisingly leaves this ball that was straightening back from the line of leg. Dharmasena took forever to give this out - maybe in doing what Joel Wilson didn't, calculate who has their reviews left. Paine does. He sends it upstairs. And it's three reds, pitching just in line, and the rest was always plumb. Paine lbw b Jack Leach 21(34) [4s-4]
reviews: Over 55.6: Review by Australia (Batting), Umpire - HDPK Dharmasena, Batsman - TD Paine (Struck down)

Commentary: Pat Cummins to Jofra Archer, out Caught by Paine!! A half-hearted appeal for caught-behind. Strangled down leg? Paine decides to review it. Fair delivery. Shortish ball, just above the ribs and Archer was looking to tickle it away. There's a spike on UltraEdge and Archer has to depart. The on-field call has been reversed. Paine reviews one correctly ... finally! The ploy to bowl short to Archer has worked. All three were on the shorter side, this time it brushed the gloves of the batter and Paine moved to his left to gobble that up. Jofra Archer c Paine b Pat Cummins 3(9)
reviews: Over 92.3: Review by Australia (Bowling), Umpire - M Erasmus, Batsman - JC Archer (Upheld)

Commentary: Sam Curran to Pat Cummins, out Lbw!! The dreaded finger of umpire Marais Erasmus goes up in a flash and Cummins has been adjudged lbw. The batter has decided to challenge it. Fair delivery. It's the inswinger from Curran and Cummins is beaten on the inside edge. Three reds on HawkEye! Australia lose a review and Curran is on a hat-trick! That looked plumb to the naked eye! Full and swinging in, Cummins isn't equipped to keep it away as tries to push. Missed the inside edge, pinned the front pad in front of the sticks. The ball-tracking showed it to be hitting middle and leg. Pat Cummins lbw b Sam Curran 0(1)
reviews: Over 53.5: Review by Australia (Batting), Umpire - M Erasmus, Batsman - PJ Cummins (Struck down)

Commentary: Jofra Archer to Warner, out Caught by Bairstow!! An appeal for caught-behind! Marais Erasmus shakes his head in denial and Root decides to review it. Fair delivery. Flashed his bat at a wide away-seaming ball did Warner. The third umpire is waiting for the UltraEdge... And, surprise.. There's a spike on the UltraEdge. The on-field call has been reversed. Yet another low score for Warner - his eighth single-digit score in nine innings. To the naked eye, it looked like it missed the edge, but thanks to the technology, the correct call is made. Was a half-hearted appeal from England, apart from Stokes (second slip). Root took his time before sending it upstairs. In the end, turned out to be a masterstroke. Warner c Bairstow b Jofra Archer 5(8) [4s-1]
reviews: Over 1.5: Review by England (Bowling), Umpire - M Erasmus, Batsman - DA Warner (Upheld)

Commentary: Mitchell Marsh to Bairstow, out Lbw!! Bairstow has been adjudged lbw by umpire Marais Erasmus and he has reviewed that call. Fair delivery. A big, booming inswinger and it crashes into Bairstow's front pad. No bat. Three reds on HawkEye! England waste a review. After all those outswingers, Marsh gets one to curl into the right-hander and Bairstow had no clue against it. The length was perfect too - a toe-crushing yorker and Bairstow was too late in bringing his bat down. The ball-tracking showed it to be hitting leg. Superb bowling, this from Marsh. He is pumped up! Bairstow lbw b Mitchell Marsh 22(55) [4s-3]
reviews: Over 59.4: Review by England (Batting), Umpire - M Erasmus, Batsman - JM Bairstow (Struck down)

Commentary: Pattinson to Broad, out Lbw!! Dead. Buried. Dead-in-glee. It's a vicious yorker, absolute brute, and umpire Gaffaney ups his DRS Karma points. Broad's mind knows only one thing, the bouncer, and he's perpetually ready, jumping up to Pattinson's proper bluffing yorker that sneaks under his bat and pins him plumb on the front boot. Three Reds.  Never mind the review .. Broad lbw b Pattinson 0(2)
reviews: Over 115.2: Review by England (Batting), Umpire - CB Gaffaney, Batsman - SCJ Broad (Struck down)

Commentary: Broad to Paine, out Caught by Denly!! This time the finger is raised. It appears that Paine was given leg-before on the field, a decision he challenges immediately due to the involvement of an inside edge. But even the catch was taken at gully, which Paine was aware of. So, all in all, it's a strange review. He would've been out one way or another. Actually, ball-tracking had it going over the stumps. But, come on, it's still a strange review. Paine c Denly b Broad 0(2)
reviews: Over 53.3: Review by Australia (Batting), Umpire - JS Wilson, Batsman - TD Paine (Struck down)

Commentary: Pat Cummins to Jofra Archer, out Caught by Paine!! Archer reviews just for the sake of it. Don't think he truly believes he's going to get away. Had left his bat hanging up while ducking underneath the short ball and such is the state of England's shambles that it flicks the bat-face through to Paine. Jofra Archer c Paine b Pat Cummins 7(8) [4s-1]
reviews: Over 26.4: Review by England (Batting), Umpire - CB Gaffaney, Batsman - JC Archer (Struck down)

Commentary: Stokes to Labuschagne, out Lbw! Given out and it's reviewed by Australia! Unless the impact is outside off, I don't see this being overturned. A surprise of a full-toss in store for Labuschagne, who is struck on the back-pad. Is there bat? Might be! Nope, no bat. Impact in-line, that was the only thing that could have saved him, and the dipping full-toss is crashing into the very center of the middle-pole. A rather eccentric dismissal, that found Labuschagne on his knees at the end of it all, but an important one for England. Labuschagne lbw b Stokes 74(129) [4s-10]
reviews: Over 51.2: Review by Australia (Batting), Umpire - JS Wilson, Batsman - M Labuschagne (Struck down)

Commentary: Jofra Archer to Pat Cummins, out Caught by Bairstow! The Archer hits bull's eye! Maiden five-for for him. Or is it? Pat Cummins has gone for the review. Yep, there's a spike as the ball goes past the bat, but there was already some background noise. Well, certainly some scope for controversy here. No conclusive evidence, but also, to the naked eye, no visible daylight between bat and ball and nothing else that could have produced the noise. The ball - a good length one in the zone, jagging away just a little to find the outside edge, giving Jofra his fifth wicket! Pat Cummins c Bairstow b Jofra Archer 0(13)
reviews: Over 49.6: Review by Australia (Batting), Umpire - JS Wilson, Batsman - PJ Cummins (Struck down)

Commentary: Woakes to Paine, out Lbw!! So this faulty umpiring is clearly transcending people now, with Chris Gaffaney carrying on the legacy left behind for him by some of his more illustrious colleagues -- getting his third decision of the day overturned. England have it in their favour now, with Woakes trapping Paine with an in-nipper as Paine plays this completely down the wrong line. Not given. Only for HawkEye to show up three reds. Paine lbw b Woakes 11(26) [4s-1]
reviews: Over 42.6: Review by England (Bowling), Umpire - CB Gaffaney, Batsman - TD Paine (Upheld)

Commentary: Broad to Khawaja, out Caught by Bairstow! Review! England go up to the third umpire! Guess what? This one is a strangler down leg, and not the usual peach of the English summer, Khawaja is across and gets a feather on the glance. The umpire is unmoved. Root signals the "T" straightaway, and the umpire spots a spike as the ball crosses the bat. Huge nick, and the on-field umpire has to go all "Wakanda Forever" and raise his finger. Khawaja c Bairstow b Broad 8(17) [4s-1]
reviews: Over 8.4: Review by England (Bowling), Umpire - CB Gaffaney, Batsman - UT Khawaja (Upheld)

Commentary: Jack Leach to Lyon, out Lbw!! Given out on the field. Lyon's decided to take it upstairs. The thing to watch here is whether this is sliding down. It came in with the arm from Leach, had Lyon playing outside the line of it. Ball-tracking's verdict is that it's hitting middle and leg. The ball had actually straightened enough from round the wicket. Lyon lbw b Jack Leach 6(17)
reviews: Over 93.1: Review by Australia (Batting), Umpire - CB Gaffaney, Batsman - NM Lyon (Struck down)

Commentary: Woakes to Smith, out Lbw!! A token review from Smith who knows he's gone. He's padded up to a full ball that's come in with the angle, hitting him right in front of off stump. Just a horrible misjudgement wherein he expected the ball to swing away from him. Ball-tracking inevitably returns three reds, and Smith has almost crossed the boundary. Another great knock from him though, which is recognized with a generous applause by the majority of the crowd to drown everything else. Smith lbw b Woakes 92(161) [4s-14]
reviews: Over 87.5: Review by Australia (Batting), Umpire - CB Gaffaney, Batsman - SPD Smith (Struck down)

Commentary: Broad to Head, out Lbw!! Aleem Dar almost gave this out, almost! Just at the last instant, he kinda hinted that it could be sliding down the hill but wasn't to be. Broad was spot on and so was my colleague Varun Dixit. Looked dead. Root didn't waste any time in sending it upstairs and England retain their review. It was full and angling in from round the wicket, always a dangerous angle at Lord's if you are a left-hander. Head gets stuck on the back foot and his tentative hop dance only made it look more ugly. Gets beaten on the inside edge and that's seeking the middle of middle. Outta here... Head lbw b Broad 7(21) [4s-1]
reviews: Over 30.1: Review by England (Bowling), Umpire - Aleem Dar, Batsman - TM Head (Upheld)

Commentary: Pat Cummins to Woakes, out Caught by Paine!! There's the wicket. There's the plan working for Australia and Cummins. Woakes has shown vulnerability to the short ball and Cummins has exploited that superbly. He kept going short and had him in all sort of trouble, this was an innocuous short ball angled down leg, but Woakes goes looking for the pull, the ball brushes the glove and Paine does the rest behind the stumps. Aleem Dar took his time before raising the finger but he made the right decision. Not sure how Woakes did not feel the ball taking the glove as he went for the review almost immediately. Woakes c Paine b Pat Cummins 32(62) [4s-3 6s-1]
reviews: Over 64.6: Review by England (Batting), Umpire - Aleem Dar, Batsman - CR Woakes (Struck down)

Commentary: Pat Cummins to Bairstow, out Caught by Bancroft!! Bairstow is very unlucky here. But he did feel it was above his wristband and hence challenged the decision. The third umpire had a couple of looks and deemed in favour of the bowling side. England have lost both their reviews now. Another short delivery that refuses to bounce, Bairstow bends and arches back, but the low bounce does him in, the ball hits the sweatband on the glove before lobbing to third slip. A simple catch for Australia and they were confident. Umpire Wilson needed a nudge and it came from his partner at square leg. A quick glance and up went the finger. Bairstow c Bancroft b Pat Cummins 6(8) [4s-1]
reviews: Over 36.6: Review by England (Batting), Umpire - JS Wilson, Batsman - JM Bairstow (Struck down)

Commentary: Lyon to Denly, out Caught by Bancroft!! A classical day-five dismissal this. Another peach from Lyon and he is getting a lot of assistance from the track, it spins sharply and there was a moment of indecision from Denly where he wasn't sure whether to go forward or stay in the crease. It clipped the inside edge of Denly and FSL takes a fine catch. Denly wasn't sure whether he had edged that and he went for the review. He was proved wrong within a minute and the umpire finally gets a decision right. Denly c Bancroft b Lyon 11(16) [4s-2]
reviews: Over 25.5: Review by England (Batting), Umpire - Aleem Dar, Batsman - JL Denly (Struck down)

Commentary: Broad to Warner, out Caught by Bairstow!! It was an instant appeal from the slip cordon as soon as the ball left Warner but Broad wasn't too keen on the review. He seemed muddled. Bairstow and the slip cordon were though, and the review shows an obvious edge. A thick one. That's the end of Warner. Got into a real tangle with this one that straightened from a good length with extra bounce, he wanted to leave it at the last moment and couldn't drag his bat out of the way completely. Kisses the edge and settles into the mitts of JB. England have the early strike that they were searching for. Warner c Bairstow b Broad 8(8) [4s-2]
reviews: Over 2.6: Review by England (Bowling), Umpire - JS Wilson, Batsman - DA Warner (Upheld)

Commentary: Woakes to Wade, out Lbw!! Now England review. Somebody stop the madness. Somebody get the umpiring right. So Wade looks really plumb here as he overbalances and falls over on the flick across the line as Woakes does what he did to Head in getting the ball to seam back in off a length. Pitching - on middle. Impact - in front of middle. Striking - the top of middle. Wade lbw b Woakes 1(5)
reviews: Over 34.6: Review by England (Bowling), Umpire - JS Wilson, Batsman - MS Wade (Upheld)

Commentary: Woakes to Head, out Lbw!! Aussies review. But when the review is one second before the timer goes out, you know how desperate this is. Okay, so Woakes' had Head trapped in the crease as this one stays low and beats him for pace to come back in off the pitch and catch him in front of middle. But Head - after a long plea - has a damn reluctant Smith's blessings to take it upstairs -- only to see three reds on the big screen. It pitches on middle, nips in and is struck on the knee roll. Head's already quite short, plus he's deep in the crease as well. Yea, the perfect recipe for disaster. But Woakes' got to be taking all the credit for this perfect set up .. across, across, across and then suddenly one comes back in to mess around with Head's head. Head lbw b Woakes 35(61) [4s-5]
reviews: Over 32.4: Review by Australia (Batting), Umpire - JS Wilson, Batsman - TM Head (Struck down)

Commentary: Woakes to Khawaja, out Caught by Bairstow!! Excellent review by Woakes and England. Bairstow didn't seem as confident as he usually is but Woakes was and Root went with his bowler. Another peach from the local boy. Fuller and in the channel of uncertainty, Khawaja was lucky to have missed the edge the previous delivery but not this time, he prods forward and leaves his bat a tad away from the body and that is enough to find the outside edge. Easy gulp for Bairstow and England have their third wicket. Khawaja c Bairstow b Woakes 13(23) [4s-2]
reviews: Over 14.2: Review by England (Bowling), Umpire - JS Wilson, Batsman - UT Khawaja (Upheld)

Commentary: Lyon to Yasir Shah, out Lbw!! Shah is adjudged lbw, he has a word with his partner and shows the 'T' sign, meaning he's reviewing it. No problem with the legality of the delivery as front foot is okay. The TV umpire is checking if there's any bat on this. Nothing on snicko. Three reds and the on-field call stays. The centurion of the first innings and the thorn in the flesh for Australia, Shah has been undone by a quicker delivery from Lyon. He's on fire and picks up his fourth wicket. Round the wicket angle, quicker and going straight on after pitching. Shah misjudges the length and stayed back. It skids on and pins him on the back pad around the knee-roll. It looked plumb and umpire Richard Illingworth was spot on with his decision. Yasir Shah lbw b Lyon 13(26) [4s-1]
reviews: Over 75.3: Review by Pakistan (Batting), Umpire - RK Illingworth, Batsman - Yasir Shah (Struck down)

Commentary: Starc to Shaheen Afridi, out Lbw!! Pakistan review: Afridi has been given out lbw first ball. He has a chat with his partner and opts to challenge the on-field call. No problem with the front foot. No bat as well and three reds says Hawkeye. He is a goner and Starc is on a hat-trick now. This looked pretty adjacent straightaway. Afridi just reviewed in hope. This was full, straight and at the stumps. The batsman is beaten for pace as it strikes him low on the pads in front of middle. Ball-tracking showed that it was crashing the leg-stump. Make that six wickets for Starc. 145kph thunderbolt which is too good for Afridi. Shaheen Afridi lbw b Starc 0(1)
reviews: Over 65.2: Review by Pakistan (Batting), Umpire - MA Gough, Batsman - Shaheen Shah Afridi (Struck down)

Commentary: Yasir Shah to Starc, out Lbw!! Starc has been given OUT LBW and he wants a review. It's a fair delivery, don't think there's bat on that. HotSpot and Snicko confirm it, ball-tracking coming up, three reds and Starc is OUT. Australia are losing wickets in a hurry now - nicely tossed up on middle, Starc went back as he looked to play for the turn, this one went straight on, slid through and crashed into Starc's pads, the impact was in front of middle and the ball was crashing into the middle-stump. Simple call for umpire Illingworth. Starc lbw b Yasir Shah 5(8)
reviews: Over 151.6: Review by Australia (Batting), Umpire - RK Illingworth, Batsman - MA Starc (Struck down)

Commentary: Starc to Shaheen Afridi, out Caught by Paine!! Starc is on a hat-trick. With the DRS debacle in England, Paine wanted to play it safe by not opting for one but it was Smith who convinced the Australian captain to go for it. On a length and outside off, Afridi goes feeling for the ball with the bat well away from the body, Shaheen Afridi c Paine b Starc 0(1)
reviews: Over 80.5: Review by Australia (Bowling), Umpire - RA Kettleborough, Batsman - Shaheen Shah Afridi (Upheld)

Commentary: Jadeja to Roston Chase, out Lbw!! Chase reviews: He's been adjudged lbw by the onfield umpire and after having a word with Brooks, he decides to challenge the call. Probably clipping the leg-stump, in my opinion. Yup, the onfield decision stays as it's just kissing the leg-stump. Chase was on his front foot to defend this, but the ball pitched around leg and spun in to some extent, just about enough to go on and fetch Jadeja his first wicket of this innings. First wicket of the morning for India as we hear Jermaine Blackwood will come in as the concussion substitute for Darren Bravo. Roston Chase lbw b Jadeja 12(36) [4s-2]
