reviews: Over 27.5: Review by West Indies (Batting), Umpire - PR Reiffel, Batsman - RL Chase (Struck down - Umpires Call)

Commentary: Gabriel to Rahane, no run, Windies review: Not quite the one that Aussies took against Leach, but looks tight. Fair delivery, no inside edge and Rahane survives as it's umpire's call on hitting. Just clipping the top of leg. Skiddy length delivery that nipped back in to beat Rahane on the inside edge, tries for a glance but got beaten. The bowler didn't look keen and the appeal wasn't strong either. Holder walked up to Gabriel and they thought 'um, why not'
reviews: Over 107.3: Review by West Indies (Bowling), Umpire - RA Kettleborough, Batsman - AM Rahane (Struck down - Umpires Call)

Commentary: Shami to Holder, no run, Loud shout for LBW and India will review. The height is the issue here - Holder is a tall man and it clipped him pretty high on the back-foot, it's a fair delivery, missed the bat by a distance and UltraEdge confirmed it. Ball-tracking in and it's umpire's call on hitting the stumps. NOT OUT will stay. The nip-backer from Shami and Holder didn't spot it, was looking to play an ambitious drive and missed, struck him on the back-foot and in front of middle, was only clipping the the top of leg-stump
reviews: Over 67.2: Review by India (Bowling), Umpire - RA Kettleborough, Batsman - JO Holder (Struck down - Umpires Call)

Commentary: Ajaz Patel to Dilruwan Perera, out Lbw!! Ajaz Patel provides the breakthrough that New Zealand were looking for this morning. It was a quicker delivery on the stumps, was on a length and Dilruwan Perera wasn't sure whether to come forward or stay back. That one moment of indecision results in his dismissal as it skids off the deck and he fails to get his bat down in time. It rapped him high on the back pad but the ball had hardly any distance to cover. Ball-tracking reckons ball would have hit a decent part on the top of the middle stump. Dilruwan Perera reviewed, Sri Lanka are lucky that it was not 'hitting' on DRS, which would have resulted in a waste of the review. Dilruwan Perera lbw b Ajaz Patel 13(54) [4s-1]
reviews: Over 74.5: Review by Sri Lanka (Batting), Umpire - BNJ Oxenford, Batsman - MDK Perera (Struck down - Umpires Call)

Commentary: Somerville to Kusal Perera, no run, Perera was given out caught when he missed this reverse sweep. Umpire Michael Gough thought he gloved this flighted delivery, the catch was taken by KW at gully. Perera discussed with Mathews for the review and went upstairs. The replay clearly showed the ball missing the wrist band on the glove and just came off the forearm, they checked for LBW too, but the ball was missing off stump as it spun too much. Review lost
reviews: Over 77.5: Review by Sri Lanka (Batting), Umpire - MA Gough, Batsman - MDKJ Perera (Struck down - Umpires Call)

Commentary: Lakmal to Ajaz Patel, out Lbw!! Ajaz has been given OUT LBW and this looked pretty plumb. He has a review in hand and he wants to use it. It's a fair delivery and he has missed it by a long way, UltraEdge confirms it. Ball Tracking in, it's umpire's call on hitting the stumps. Gough's original call stays and New Zealand have been bowled out for 249. An excellent morning for Sri Lanka, took 5 for 44 to mop up the visitors for a modest score. Coming to the ball, it was full and slid back with the angle, burst past Ajaz's inside edge as he flicked, caught him in front of middle and it was an easy call for the umpire. Ajaz Patel lbw b Lakmal 0(1)
reviews: Over 83.2: Review by New Zealand (Batting), Umpire - MA Gough, Batsman - AY Patel (Struck down - Umpires Call)

Commentary: Anrich Nortje to Kohli, out Lbw!! Nortje's maiden Test scalp is Virat Kohli. Time to update your CV, mate. Couldn't have asked for any better. Perfect nip-backer from the pacer. Like Rabada setting up Pujara, Nortje too followed the same ploy to nip out the Indian captain. Shaped in sharply off the deck, Kohli plays all around it with feet chained to the crease. It eludes the inside edge and thuds him on the pad around the knee roll. The moment it struck him, Kohli knew that he was in trouble. Kohli lbw b Anrich Nortje 12(22) [4s-2]
reviews: Over 15.3: Review by India (Batting), Umpire - NJ Llong, Batsman - V Kohli (Struck down - Umpires Call)

Commentary: Ashwin to du Plessis, no run, loud appeal for lbw as du Plessis misses the sweep. Not given. Was the impact outside off? Well, India have decided to challenge that decision. It's a fair delivery. The off-break spun in and went underneath the bat. Clearly no bat. Over to ball-tracking. Impact - umpire's call. Wickets - hitting. The on-field call stays and India don't lose a review. The impact did look dodgy to the naked eye as the South African shuffled across before getting down
reviews: Over 17.4: Review by India (Bowling), Umpire - CB Gaffaney, Batsman - F du Plessis (Struck down - Umpires Call)

Commentary: Philander to Agarwal, no run, Jeez, that's a South African review for LBW/caught behind. Huge appeal. Philander didn't even bother to appeal and ran straight through and was more than halfway down the pitch before turning back. The umpire shakes his head. Mayank seemed to be turning his back as though going off. LBW: impact, umpire's call outside off, and clipping the top of the stumps, again umpire's call. Given not out, review retained. An in-seamer, beats the inside edge, and clips the pads through to the wicketkeeper. Certainly no bat on that. Loads of drama...
reviews: Over 4.4: Review by South Africa (Bowling), Umpire - CB Gaffaney, Batsman - MA Agarwal (Struck down - Umpires Call)

Commentary: Jadeja to Maharaj, out Lbw!! India just two wickets away from closing this game. Very similar to Philander's dismissal this. Just that Jadeja pulled his length a fraction and got a bit of extra bounce, Maharaj looks to tuck it into the leg-side with a closed bat face but the ball escapes his outside edge in a jiffy to graze him high on the back pad. This time umpire Chris Gaffaney had no second thoughts in giving it out and it proved to be a fair call in the end. Maharaj went up for the review in hope that it would miss the stumps, wasn't to be - umpire's call around the top of off stump. Maharaj lbw b Jadeja 0(1)
reviews: Over 26.5: Review by South Africa (Batting), Umpire - CB Gaffaney, Batsman - KA Maharaj (Struck down - Umpires Call)

Commentary: D Piedt to Pujara, no run, tries to tuck himself into a bat pad defence as the ball spins in from a length, Pujara was slightly late and a closed bat face means it hit him on the pad first before deflecting onto the splice of the bat. One of the close-in fielders thought it was bat first but the bowler didn't. He was spot on and implored Faf to go for the review. Looked mighty close with technology in play but only if the umpire's verdict was out it would have remained that way. Wasn't to be
reviews: Over 47.6: Review by South Africa (Bowling), Umpire - CB Gaffaney, Batsman - CA Pujara (Struck down - Umpires Call)

Commentary: Ashwin to Rabada, no run, Rabada just hung back anticipating Ashwin to spin it away from him, it didn't. Just came in with the angle and skids on to hit him on the back pad after he got beaten on the outside edge. Ashwin was conident, Kohli wasn't sure and they go up for it with six seconds left on the DRS timer. Proved to be a good one until that umpire's call popped up
reviews: Over 128.1: Review by India (Bowling), Umpire - CB Gaffaney, Batsman - K Rabada (Struck down - Umpires Call)

Commentary: Maharaj to Hanuma Vihari, no run, South Africa review an LBW. Vihari is down on the dance, something he realizes isn't close and so looks to block. But it straightens in .. and it's three reds. But, but, the forward dance has taken him three meters down, and the rules mean it to be an umpire's call
reviews: Over 126.2: Review by South Africa (Bowling), Umpire - RK Illingworth, Batsman - GH Vihari (Struck down - Umpires Call)

Commentary: Ishant to Mithun, no run, huge shout for leg-before, not given. Tell you what, this looked really close in real time and it's no wonder Kohli has reviewed. Length ball that cut in slightly to smash Mithun's front pad. Only clipping leg stump as per ball-tracking, so Mithun survives
reviews: Over 4.1: Review by India (Bowling), Umpire - M Erasmus, Batsman - Mohammad Mithun (Struck down - Umpires Call)

Commentary: Ishant to Shadman Islam, out Lbw!! There's the one on the pads, and it's gone! It was another outswinger, but the line was much straighter. Swings away late, opens him up completely to beat the outside edge and hits the back pad. Islam's gone for a review, but don't think he's going to find much luck. Yeah, it's clipping off stump. Just brilliant from Ishant. All of his first four balls were wide of off stump, and then this peach that moved away from middle and off. In total command of what he's doing. Shadman Islam lbw b Ishant 0(5)
reviews: Over 0.5: Review by Bangladesh (Batting), Umpire - M Erasmus, Batsman - Shadman Islam (Struck down - Umpires Call)

Commentary: U Yadav to Mithun, 1 run, loud shout for LBW, Umesh nods his head and Kohli asks for a review. Fair delivery, is it pad first? It looks close, the bat is very close to the pad. There's a spike on the UltraEdge when the ball clipped the front-pad. The third umpire is Nitin Menon and he's taking a lot of time on this. He decides it's pad first. Ball-tracking in, it's umpire's call on impact and the decision will stay. Was going on and smashing into the off-stump, but that doesn't change the decision. Nicely bowled by Umesh, the nip-backer and Mithun was late in getting his bat down, tried to squeeze it behind square and gets lucky that he managed to get marginally outside the line of off-stump
reviews: Over 13.6: Review by India (Bowling), Umpire - RJ Tucker, Batsman - Mohammad Mithun (Struck down - Umpires Call)

Commentary: Sam Curran to Wade, out Lbw!! And Wade's walking-across-whips prove to be too much of an adventure. Beaten on pace, beaten on angle .. so much so that he's nearly on the floor as he flicks all around this and gets struck low on the outside of the back pad. Umpire Dharmasena's confused(?) but then gets convinced by the long strong appeal, and despite the inswing, will stand vindicated with the DRS ' HawkEye showing it to be on an umpire's call with enough kiss on the leg-stump. Wade lbw b Sam Curran 19(31) [4s-2]
reviews: Over 36.4: Review by Australia (Batting), Umpire - HDPK Dharmasena, Batsman - MS Wade (Struck down - Umpires Call)

Commentary: Hazlewood to Denly, no run, slanted in, Denly was late to spot that and hence the delay in getting forward. Ends up getting and inside edge onto his boot
reviews: Over 9.3: Review by Australia (Batting), Umpire - HDPK Dharmasena, Batsman - M Labuschagne (Struck down - Umpires Call)

Commentary: Lyon to Rory Burns, no run, sliding on with the arm, Burns turns it with soft hands into the on-side
reviews: Over 53.1: Review by England (Batting), Umpire - HDPK Dharmasena, Batsman - JM Bairstow (Struck down - Umpires Call)

Commentary: Jack Leach to Wade, no run, England review umpire Wilson: So Wade was on the walk across his stumps to flick, but the spin on this one gets a little too big to beat his bat and rap him on the back of the back leg's thigh pad. And it stays umpire's call on the ball clipping the outside of leg-stump
reviews: Over 37.6: Review by England (Bowling), Umpire - JS Wilson, Batsman - MS Wade (Struck down - Umpires Call)

Commentary: Broad to Warner, out Lbw!! If Warner's not hit this, he's a goner! Oh it's not even close to his bat, but that doesn't stop him from reviewing. Won't find much joy from ball-tracking though, which confirms the ball was smashing leg stump, although the impact was marginal on off so Australia retain the review. Jagged in sharply from round the wicket, thudded onto the back leg. Warner has a smile on his face as he walks back to loud boos. Warner lbw b Broad 0(2)
reviews: Over 1.2: Review by Australia (Batting), Umpire - JS Wilson, Batsman - DA Warner (Struck down - Umpires Call)

Commentary: Jofra Archer to Bancroft, out Lbw!! Maiden wicket for Jofra Archer in Test match cricket! And he has provided the breakthrough that England were after this morning. It was a peach from Archer as it darted back in significantly off the deck at a serious pace. Bancroft was pinned to the crease and he had no answers to it, it burst through his defence and struck him on the pads. It looked adjacent to the naked eye and the umpire Aleem Dar raised his finger straightaway. Bancroft wasn't pleased with the decision and he went for a review. But the ball was just about clipping the stumps. And Bancroft will have to depart. Bancroft lbw b Jofra Archer 13(66) [4s-1]
reviews: Over 22.5: Review by Australia (Batting), Umpire - Aleem Dar, Batsman - CT Bancroft (Struck down - Umpires Call)

Commentary: Pat Cummins to Buttler, no run, another decision sent upstairs. This one is for lbw and Australia have asked for a review. The impact is in line but it is just clipping the stumps. Umpire's call it is in the end and Buttler will survive.  This one was much straight from Pat Cummins and it nipped back in too, missed the inside edge of Buttler and struck him on the pads. Just a tad high!
reviews: Over 28.5: Review by Australia (Bowling), Umpire - JS Wilson, Batsman - JC Buttler (Struck down - Umpires Call)

Commentary: Hazlewood to Babar Azam, no run, loud shout for LBW, Hazlewood was celebrating and is surprised as Kettleborough says NO. The Australians want a review. It's a fair delivery, was there an inside edge on that? Is the height an issue? Nothing on HotSpot and Snicko confirms it. It's umpire's call on hitting the wickets, the original call stays. A tight call and Babar could consider himself lucky, the inswinger from Hazlewood, pitched around off and nipped back in sharply, caught Babar in the crease as he played all around it, struck just below the knee-roll and the ball was only clipping the top of leg
reviews: Over 49.1: Review by Australia (Bowling), Umpire - RA Kettleborough, Batsman - Babar Azam (Struck down - Umpires Call)

Commentary: Starc to Azhar Ali, out Lbw!! Azhar Ali has been given out lbw. He reviews just in time (one second left literally). Fair delivery, no inside edge and it's umpire's call on hitting. Review retained but the Pakistan skipper will have to walk back to the dressing room. A sharp in-angler from a good length and Azhar Ali was found guilty of moving too far across, pretty much missed a straight delivery and got pinned in line with middle and leg. Instant verdict from umpire Richard Kettleborough and Azhar Ali thought long and hard before going upstairs. The skid and pace of Starc may have hurried the Pakistan skipper who got beaten on the inside edge, only to be adjudged lbw moments later. Azhar Ali lbw b Starc 5(9) [4s-1]
reviews: Over 2.5: Review by Pakistan (Batting), Umpire - RK Illingworth, Batsman - Azhar Ali (Struck down - Umpires Call)

Commentary: Yasir Shah to Hazlewood, out Lbw!! Hazlewood has been given OUT LBW and he wants a review. It's a fair delivery, there's no bat on that - HotSpot doesn't reveal anything, but there's nothing on Snicko as well. Hawk-Eye in: Pitching in line, impact in line and it's umpire's call on hitting the stumps. Australia have been bowled out for 580. Nice bit of bowling from Yasir, slipped in the leg-break, pitched around off, spun back in and past Hazlewood's front-foot stride, rapped in front of middle and was doing enough to clip the leg-stump. Hazlewood lbw b Yasir Shah 5(10) [4s-1]
reviews: Over 157.4: Review by Australia (Batting), Umpire - RK Illingworth, Batsman - JR Hazlewood (Struck down - Umpires Call)
